item.immersivetech.material.salt.name: 鹽
tile.immersivetech.fluidDistWater.name: 蒸餾水
tile.immersivetech.fluidSteam.name: 蒸汽

ie.manual.category.it.name: 沉浸科技
ie.manual.entry.cokeOvenAdvanced.name: 高級焦爐
ie.manual.entry.cokeOvenAdvanced0:
高級焦爐是一種多方塊結構，能夠讓玩家快速的取得焦煤和雜酚油。
在先前的章節已經展示了搭建結構，使用工程師錘敲擊中心的強化焦爐磚方塊即可構建。
ie.manual.entry.cokeOvenAdvanced1:
它支持自動化輸入輸出，也可以配合預熱器來提供熱空氣，加快進度。
這個焦爐是用的強化磚構建而成的，極力推薦你將首次取得的鋼材用於製作這個結構。
和強化高爐一樣，焦煤從前端輸出，雜酚油從後端輸出。煤炭從頂部輸入。
ie.manual.entry.cokeOvenAdvanced2: 焦爐預熱器可以用於加快煤炭的精煉速度。每個焦爐最多只能有兩個預熱器連接在兩側埠，並且每個預熱器都需要<config;i;cokeOvenPreheater_consumption>Flux/t開始工作。
ie.manual.entry.distiller.name: 蒸餾器
ie.manual.entry.distiller0:
蒸餾器是一種多方塊結構機械，它可以將水蒸餾成蒸餾水和鹽。
具體結構如上圖所示，全部搭建完成後，使用工程師錘右擊正面中央的鐵板金屬塊完成搭建。
ie.manual.entry.distiller1:
正中心紅點的控制面板是使用紅石信號控制機器開關的介面，紅石信號的開關與機器的開關的關係可以透過使用工程師錘右擊紅石控制面板來反轉。
水可以通過機器左側標有藍點的艙口輸入到蒸餾器中。相對的另一側帶有橙點的艙口則用作液體輸出，而另一個橙點艙口作為物品的輸出口。
蒸餾器需要能源供應才能將水蒸餾成蒸餾水和鹽。
它會將一桶水蒸餾成500mB的蒸餾水。
ie.manual.entry.solarTower.name: 太陽能集熱塔
ie.manual.entry.solarTower0:
太陽能集熱塔是一種多方塊結構機械，它可以利用陽光，將水轉換成蒸汽。
具體結構如上圖所示，全部搭建完成後，使用工程師錘右擊正面的紅石工程塊完成搭建。
ie.manual.entry.solarTower1:
太陽能集熱塔可以將水或轉換成蒸汽。
一桶蒸餾水可以產生750mB的蒸汽。
一桶水可以產生500mB的蒸汽。
水可以通過左側和右側的標有藍點的兩個艙口輸入太陽能集熱塔。背面帶有橙點的艙口用作流體輸出。
太陽能集熱塔至少需要一個太陽能反射鏡才能工作。
ie.manual.entry.solarTower2:
太陽能反射鏡是將太陽光反射到太陽能集熱塔中心的多方塊結構機械。
具體結構如上圖所示，全部搭建完成後，使用工程師錘右擊正面的銀塊完成搭建。
ie.manual.entry.solarTower3: 為了實現工作，反射鏡的中心（銀塊位置）與太陽能塔之間不能有阻隔方塊，反射鏡的中心（銀塊位置）必須對準太陽能塔的中心（塔中間開口位置），反射鏡和太陽能塔之間的距離必須在<config;i;solarTower_minRange>-<config;i;solarTower_maxRange>個方塊之間。顯然，太陽能塔和反射鏡只能在白天工作。
ie.manual.entry.steamTurbine.name: 蒸汽輪機
ie.manual.entry.steamTurbine0:
蒸汽輪機是使用蒸汽來產生能量的多方塊結構機械。
具體結構如上圖所示，全部搭建完成後，使用工程師錘右擊紅石工程塊那一側的正中心的鋼塊完成搭建。
ie.manual.entry.steamTurbine1:
正中心紅點的控制面板是使用紅石信號控制機器開關的介面，紅石信號的開關與機器的開關的關係可以透過使用工程師錘右擊紅石控制面板來反轉。
機器前方的流體管道口為蒸汽的輸入口。動能輸出口位於機器後部（鋼塊處）。你可以從機器的頂部管道把蒸汽冷卻後冷凝殘餘的水排出（不是必要的）。
ie.manual.entry.boiler.name: 蒸汽鍋爐
ie.manual.entry.boiler0:
鍋爐是一種多方塊結構，它使用液體燃料和水來生產蒸汽。
具體結構如上圖所示，全部搭建完成後，使用工程師錘右擊紅石工程塊那一側的正中心的鐵板金屬塊完成搭建。
ie.manual.entry.boiler1:
正中心紅點的控制面板是使用紅石信號控制機器開關的介面，紅石信號的開關與機器的開關的關係可以透過使用工程師錘右擊紅石控制面板來反轉。
水可以從左側（裝飾有橙邊方形端）的標有藍點的艙口輸入，而柴油則從機器右側藍點艙口輸入。上方的橙點艙口用於流體輸出。
ie.manual.entry.alternator.name: 交流發電機
ie.manual.entry.alternator0:
交流發電機是將蒸汽輪機的動能轉換為電能的多方塊結構
具體結構如上圖所示，全部搭建完成後，使用工程師錘右擊高壓線圈那一側的正中心的重型工程塊完成搭建。
ie.manual.entry.alternator1:
要發電的話，它需要連接（）的動能軸那端來配合工作。將輪機動能軸連接到交流發電機的傳動端（中間有鋼塊的那端），而電能輸出端則在另一端的左右兩邊。發電機根據輪機所提供的動能速度來產生最高Flux/t的能量。
而交流發電機本身可以儲存Flux的能量，它能在每個埠輸出Flux/t的能量。
ie.manual.entry.alternator2: 蒸汽輪機和搭配的交流發電機
ie.manual.entry.redstone.name: 紅石計時器
ie.manual.entry.redstone0: §6紅石計時器§r擁有輸出紅石脈衝的功能，材質中的紅心方形方塊端為脈衝輸出端，上方為連接紅石線纜的控制端。脈衝的頻率取決於設定好的延遲。你可以在GUI中設定脈衝延遲的數據，GUI中設定10秒以下的脈衝精度為0.5秒，10秒以上的脈衝精度為1秒。紅石計時器可以使用紅石信號停止。
tile.immersivetech.fluidFlueGas.name: 煙道氣
chat.immersivetech.fluid_pump.fill_first: Pump will fill internal tank first, then push out contents
chat.immersivetech.fluid_pump.push_only_: Pump will only push out contents

ie.manual.entry.advancedCokeOven.name: Advanced Coke Oven
ie.manual.entry.advancedCokeOven0:
The Advanced Coke Oven is a multiblock structure that allows faster production of Coal Coke and Creosote Oil.
The structure is built as shown above and formed by using the Engineer's Hammer on the central Reinforced Coke Brick Block.
ie.manual.entry.advancedCokeOven1:
It allows the automation of input and output of items, it can also be outfitted with preheaters to speed up the process by addition of hot air.
The furnace is made from reinforced bricks, so you'd be advised to spend your first batches of steel on this upgrade.
Similar to the Improved Blast Furnace, Coal Coke is output at the front and Creosote Oil at the back. Coal is fed in through the top.
ie.manual.entry.advancedCokeOven2: Coke Oven Preheaters are used to speed up the refinement process of coal. Each oven can have up to two preheaters connected to the ports on each side, and each preheater requires <config;i;cokeOvenPreheater_consumption> Flux/t to operate.
ie.manual.entry.boiler2: Before being capable of boiling any water, the structure needs to warm up first, which requires fuel. If disabled or not fed with enough fuel, the structure will slowly cool down, taking about <config;d;boiler_cooldownTime> seconds to fully cool down from working temperature. The default fuel is Diesel.
ie.manual.entry.fluidValve.name: Fluid Valve
ie.manual.entry.fluidValve0: The §6Fluid Valve§r can limit fluids moving through it. You can specify in the GUI specific paramaters or it can be controlled by Redstone signal strength. Redstone with a signal of 15 is off. Enable Redstone Mode by sneaking with a Hammer.
ie.manual.entry.loadController.name: Load Controller
ie.manual.entry.loadController0: The §6Load Controller§r can limit energy moving through it. You can specify in the GUI specific paramaters or it can be controlled by Redstone signal strength. Redstone with a signal of 15 is off. Enable Redstone Mode by sneaking with a Hammer.
ie.manual.entry.openBarrel.name: Open Metal Barrel
ie.manual.entry.openBarrel.subtext: Open to the Sun or Clouds?
ie.manual.entry.openBarrel0: The §6Open Metal Barrel§r is a single block tank like the Metal Barrel but with an open top. Fluid can be put in by hand. The Top is Input only and the Bottom is Output only. Leave it out in the Rain and watch it fill! In a Thunderstom Twice as fast! However, don't leave it out in warm environments, water just may evaporate.
ie.manual.entry.stackLimiter.name: Stack Limiter
ie.manual.entry.stackLimiter0: The §6Stack Limiter§r can limit items moving through it. You can specify in the GUI specific paramaters or it can be controlled by Redstone signal strength. Redstone with a signal of 15 is off. Enable Redstone Mode by sneaking with a Hammer.
ie.manual.entry.steamTurbine2:
Applying a redstone signal to the control panel at the front will halt the machine's progress, this behavior can be inverted by use of the Engineer's Hammer.
The fluid pipe on front of the machine is the input. The kinetic energy output is in the rear of the machine (Steel Block). Optionally, fluids can be retrieved through the output pipe on the top of the machine.
ie.manual.entry.gasTurbine.name: Gas Turbine
ie.manual.entry.gasTurbine0: The Gas Turbine is a multiblock structure that uses combustible fuels to produce kinetic energy. The structure is built as shown, and formed by using the Engineer's hammer on the central steel block (short side). To work, the turbine needs an <link;alternator;§o§nAlternator§r>.
ie.manual.entry.gasTurbine1: When the turbine is supplied with adequate fuel, the turbine will slowly speed up until it hits max speed and efficiency about 30 seconds into the spinup process. Some fuels may require large enough amounts to be fed into the turbine to require pressurized transport, and if the turbine runs out of fuel it willl begin to slow down. If the turbine is at speed while shut down, it will slowly lose speed. If it slows down to below 1/4 speed, it will need to be spun back up before it can be used again.
ie.manual.entry.gasTurbine2: The fluid pipe on the front of the turbine is the input, and the two power plugs on the sides of the turbine each serve a different input purpose. The HV plug consumes 4096 IF/t to start the turbine up to 1/4 speed, at which point more flux input will cause the turbine to stall and not spin up past 1/4 speed. The MV plug uses 1024 IF to ignite the fuel if the turbine is not currently burning fuel - this happens on startup and any time the turbine has no fuel for 3 or more seconds.
ie.manual.entry.gasTurbine3: The turbine outputs kinetic energy from the rear, and the result gasses just below the kinetic energy output. These gasses have a special place, in that they can be burned to increase the efficiency of the turbine.  While usually worse than the diesel generator, for a greater power output and complexity, this output is where the gas turbine really shines. CCGT (or COGAS for the mariners out there) allows even larger returns on combustible fuels when used in the boiler for steam power.
ie.manual.entry.steelBarrel.name: Steel Metal Barrel
ie.manual.entry.steelBarrel0: The §6Steel Metal Barrel§r is a single block tank that provides double the space of fluids over a Metal Barrel. Fluid can be put in by hand. The Top and Bottom sides can be configured for input or output with a Hammer.
ie.manual.entry.steelTank.name: Steel Fluid Tank
ie.manual.entry.steelTank0: The Steel Fluid Tank is a multiblock that provides space for even larger amounts of fluids. It will store up to <config;i;steelTank_tankSize> mB of any fluid, which can be piped in through the top or bottom block. Fluids can only be extracted from the bottom center block.
ie.manual.entry.steelTank1: Applying a redstone signal to the bottom center block will make the tank output automatically, a comparator placed there will emit a redstone signal proportional to how full the tank is. Attaching the comparator to one of the top 4 layers results in a signal proportional to the height of the comparator. For example, a comparator attached to the second layer of a tank would not emit any signal until the tank is 1/4 full and have a signal strength of 15 if the tank is half full or more.
ie.manual.entry.coolingTower.name: Cooling Tower
ie.manual.entry.coolingTower0:
The Cooling Tower is a multiblock structure that converts exhaust steam back into water.
The structure is built as shown above and formed by using the Engineer's Hammer on the Heavy Engineering block.
ie.manual.entry.coolingTower1: Exhaust Steam goes into the block to the left of the Heavy Engineering block (side with red gauge indicator) while water or distilled water goes into the right one (side with blue gauge indicator).
ie.manual.entry.heatExchanger.name: Heat Exchanger
ie.manual.entry.heatExchanger0:
The Heat Exchanger is a multiblock structure that quickly moves heat from one fluid to another.
The structure is built as shown above and formed by using the Engineer's Hammer on the central Iron Sheetmetal next to the Redstone Engineering Block.
ie.manual.entry.heatExchanger1:
Applying a redstone signal to the control panel at the front will halt the machine's progress, this behavior can be inverted by use of the Engineer's Hammer.
Water and can be fed to the Heat Exchanger via a hatch on the top that is marked with a blue dot. The hatch with the orange dot at the top serves as the fluid output for steam.
ie.manual.entry.heatExchanger2: <link;gasTurbine;§n§oFlue Gas§r> can be fed to the hatch marked with a blue dot on the bottom layer. The hatch marked with the orange dot at the bottom layer serves as the fluid output for previously hot fluids.
ie.manual.entry.computer.boiler.name: Boiler ☎
ie.manual.entry.computer.distiller.name: Distiller ☎
ie.manual.entry.computer.solarTower.name: Solar Tower ☎
ie.manual.entry.computer.gasTurbine.name: Gas Turbine ☎
ie.manual.entry.computer.steamTurbine0:
§lgetSpeed()§r: returns the speed of the turbine in RPM.
§lgetTankInfo()§r: returns information about the turbine's steam tank.
§lgetOutputTankInfo()§r: returns information about the turbine's output tank.
ie.manual.entry.computer.boiler0:
§lgetHeat()§r: returns the boiler's heat level.
§lgetFuelTankInfo()§r: returns information about the boiler's fuel tank.
§lgetInputTankInfo()§r: returns information about the boiler's input tank.
§lgetOutputTankInfo()§r: returns information about the boiler's output tank.
ie.manual.entry.computer.boiler1:
§lgetFullCanisters()§r: returns a table with information about the full fluid canisters in the machine, with the keys "input" and "output" referring to each tank.
§lgetEmptyCanisters()§r: returns a table with information about the empty fluid canisters in the machine, with the keys "input" and "output" referring to each tank.
ie.manual.entry.computer.distiller0:
§lgetEnergyStored()§r: returns the energy stored in the distiller's internal buffer.
§lgetMaxEnergyStored()§r: returns the distiller's internal energy buffer's maximum capacity
§lgetInputTankInfo()§r: returns information about the distiller's input tank.
§lgetOutputTankInfo()§r: returns information about the distiller's output tank.
ie.manual.entry.computer.distiller1:
§lgetFullCanisters()§r: returns a table with information about the full fluid canisters in the machine, with the keys "input" and "output" referring to each tank.
§lgetEmptyCanisters()§r: returns a table with information about the empty fluid canisters in the machine, with the keys "input" and "output" referring to each tank.
ie.manual.entry.computer.solarTower0:
§lgetReflectors()§r: returns a table of the valid reflectors connected to the solar tower.
§lgetInputTankInfo()§r: returns information about the tower's input tank.
§lgetOutputTankInfo()§r: returns information about the tower's output tank.
ie.manual.entry.computer.solarTower1:
§lgetFullCanisters()§r: returns a table with information about the full fluid canisters in the machine, with the keys "input" and "output" referring to each tank.
§lgetEmptyCanisters()§r: returns a table with information about the empty fluid canisters in the machine, with the keys "input" and "output" referring to each tank.
ie.manual.entry.computer.gasTurbine0:
§lgetSpeed()§r: returns the speed of the turbine in RPM.
§lgetInputTankInfo()§r: returns information about the turbine's fuel tank.
§lgetOutputTankInfo()§r: returns information about the turbine's output tank.
ie.manual.entry.computer.heatExchanger0:
§lgetFirstInputTankInfo()§r: returns a table with information about the heat exchanger's first input tank (upper loop).
§lgetSecondInputTankInfo()§r: returns a table with information about the heat exchanger's second input tank (lower loop).
ie.manual.entry.computer.heatExchanger1:
§lgetFirstOutputTankInfo()§r: returns a table with information about the heat exchanger's first output tank (upper loop).
§lgetSecondOutputTankInfo()§r: returns a table with information about the heat exchanger's second output tank (lower loop).
ie.manual.entry.fluidPipes3:
In order for the pump to pick up fluid blocks, it will need a power input at the top and a redstone signal. Pumps can also be used to extract from tanks and other fluid containers that do not have an automatic output. This will also require a redstone signal, but won't consume power.

Pumps have a new mode! The operating mode of the Fluid Pump can be changed by right clicking it with an Engineer's Wire Cutter. Toggle the mode if it's not behaving as expected.
